summary: Completed testing of theme customization feature for Perennia e-commerce website. Backend APIs (10/10 tests passed) and frontend admin panel working correctly. Theme color changes, layout toggles, and settings persistence all functional.
critical_code_review_comments: Theme customization implementation is well-structured with CSS variables applied via applyThemeColors() function
Settings persistence works correctly through /api/settings (GET) and /api/admin/settings (PUT) endpoints
Admin authentication properly enforced for settings updates
context_for_next_testing_agent: Theme customization feature fully tested. Admin can change colors via preset themes or custom color pickers, toggle homepage sections (hero, categories, featured, about, newsletter), and update logo URL. All changes persist to database and reflect on homepage via CSS variables.

theme_color_customization.details: Verified changing primary color in admin reflects on homepage. Tested Rose Gold preset - primary color changed from #D4AF37 to #B76E79 and was visible on homepage.

layout_toggles.details: Verified 5 toggle switches for homepage sections (Hero, Categories, Featured, About Snippet, Newsletter). API correctly saves and returns boolean values.

logo_update.details: Logo displays correctly with transparent background. Logo URL can be updated via admin panel and persists to database.

admin_settings_persistence.details: Settings are saved via PUT /api/admin/settings and loaded via GET /api/settings. Changes persist across page refreshes.

css_variables_dynamic_update.details: applyThemeColors() function correctly sets CSS variables (--brand-gold, --brand-turquoise, --bg-default, etc.) on document.documentElement. Colors update in real-time when settings are saved.
